chapter.title: Creating Developer Accounts
chapter.para: When you first sign up for a developer account in the Sandbox, you will receive a developer account with permissions that allow you to perform development tasks, administer your Sandbox, and ingest data.

Your Sandbox includes a tool for creating new users with the same permissions or a subset of the permissions. For example, you may decide to create several applications developers to work on your application, but only one person who will ingest data.
When creating a new account, you can create users with the following roles:

listitem.para: Sandbox Administrators can perform most of the administrative tasks in a Sandbox. This includes creating new developer accounts, registering applications, and creating landing zones.

para.emphasis: Only users with this role can sign in to Production and submit application registration requests in Production.

listitem.para: Application Developers can use the Register Application system tool to register their applications for a Sandbox instance.

Ingestion Users can use the Create Landing Zone system tool to set up and configure landing zones. A landing zone allows users with ingestion rights to upload Ed-Fi XML, which will then be ingested into the database and then used for application development. When Ingestion Users in the same Sandbox tenant are assigned the same EdOrg, they share a landing zone and can see each other's uploads and log messages.

section.title: Creating a New Developer

step.para: If this is your first access to the Sandbox, or if you are accessing it after a recent upgrade to the software license, click Agree to accept the License Agreement.
Click Manage Developer Accounts under System Tools to open the Manage Developer Accounts page.
Scroll to the bottom of the page and click the Add User button.
Fill out the form in the Add a User page.

listitem.para: Full Name - Enter the user's first name and last name.
Email - Enter the user's email address. All users that you create will receive emails that allow them to activate their accounts.

Role - Select a primary role for the user. Note: If you select Sandbox Administrator, you can still add the Ingestion User or Application Developer roles using the checkboxes on this form. However, only a Sandbox Administrator can create new administrative users.
Application Developer - Select whether or not to give the user the application developer role.
Ingestion User - Select whether or not to give this user the ability to ingest data to your Sandbox.

step.para: Click Save. The application should redirect you to the Manage Administrator Accounts page.

section.para: The user will appear in the table on the Manage Administrator Accounts page. The user will also receive an email that begins the process of activating an account.
If you need to change an existing user's contact information or role, click Edit. If you need to delete a user, click Delete.

section.title: User Account Activation
section.para: After you've created a new user, the user must activate the account. The following is the process for activating a new account:

step.para: The user receives an email containing a link to the first page in the account activation process. The user clicks the link to go to the first page.

The user enters his or her email address as the user ID. Once the user submits the form, an email is sent to the user that contains a link to the Reset Password page. The user clicks the link in the email to go to the Reset Password page.
The user enters a password. Once the page is saved, the user's administrative account is activated for the Sandbox.

section.para: The user will receive a welcome email once the process is complete and the account is active.
